text:
That’s a great way of looking at it and it makes a lot of sense, thank you!

Wow, even if it isn’t updated your work is still so impressive! The movement look so realistic, even on very cartoon-y rigs. It’s absolutely amazing! What beings/objects do you enjoy animating the most?

It’s been really tough, but I think the lectures are doing a good job of covering the basic stuff this semester, so I’m hoping to be able to focus on more artsy stuff in my second year. I’ve found that I really love modelling, although I do find UVing and texturing very difficult, so I really need to work on that more in order to make complete looking assets. I’m using maya mostly, with bits of zBrush for any organic models.

I would also like to ask your advice on what methods you use to manage your time effectively, as I really struggle with organisation and meeting deadlines. I know it’s a very broad question, but any of your input as someone who has both studied animation at university and worked in the industry would be helpful to me.
